definition: lit. to work like an ox, to work like a horse; fig. to work extremely hard

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
surname Niu

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess

sentences.english: Leisure life, even cow does not need to Work Like Cow now.
sentences.chinese: 休閒自在，現今的牛也不用做牛做馬了。

sentences.english: Honey, I’ll be at your service all my life.
sentences.chinese: 寶貝，我會一輩子爲你做牛做馬。

sentences.english: They agree to pass their lives in incessant slavery.
sentences.chinese: 他們同意永遠做牛做馬。

sentences.english: Do cattle and horses, when you become old, or has been abandoned patriarchal grandfather.
sentences.chinese: 做牛做馬，人老珠黃時，還是被重男輕女的姥爺拋棄。

sentences.english: I must be the only white servant of a black man in the whole damn country.
sentences.chinese: 我肯定是整個國家裏唯一一個爲黑人做牛做馬的白人。

definition: chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
to make fun of/to seek diversion
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)

definition: old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent

traitor to one's love/heartless rat
wealthy son-in-law/wealthy husband
